item.title: Manage TLS Certificates for Kubernetes Users
item.description: User Steps (Part 1) Download cfssl mkdir ~/bin curl -s -L -o ~/bin/cfssl https://pkg.cfssl.org/R1.2/cfssl_linux-amd64 curl -s -L -o ~/bin/cfssljson https://pkg.cfssl.org/R1.2/cfssljson_linux-amd64 chmod +x ~/bin/{cfssl,cfssljson} export PATH=$PATH:~/bin Create a key and csr certificate echo '{"CN":"juan.enciso","hosts":[""],"key":{"algo":"rsa","size":2048}}' \ | cfssl genkey - | cfssljson -bare juan.enciso Signing the certificate create a YAML file named certsignrequest.yml and send it to kubernetes Admin apiVersion: certificates.k8s.io/v1beta1 kind: CertificateSigningRequest metadata: name: user-request-juan.
